purpose: The code appears to collect system information including internal and external IP addresses, hostname, user details, and package metadata, then sends this data via HTTPS POST request to a Discord webhook.
anomalies: Use of hardcoded Discord webhook URL suggesting potential data exfiltration
Sending sensitive system information to external service without user consent
External IP lookup using ipinfo.io API
Discord webhook payload contains extensive system metadata
Potential obfuscation in variable names like ___resolved
analysis: This code collects comprehensive system information including IP addresses, hostnames, usernames, DNS servers, and package metadata. It then sends this sensitive data through an HTTPS POST request to a hardcoded Discord webhook endpoint. The purpose is clearly to exfiltrate system information to an external party. The code uses multiple Node.js built-in modules for system introspection and network communication, with no apparent sanitization or user consent mechanisms.
conclusion: This is malicious code designed for data exfiltration. It collects and sends sensitive system information to a remote Discord webhook without user knowledge or consent.
